description: paleo- +‎ -graphy; imitating Latin palaeographia for the first sense and French paléographie and paléogéographie for the second and third senses.

nouns.description: paleography (countable and uncountable, plural paleographies) (American spelling)

entries.meaning: The study of old or ancient forms of writing.
Ancient scripts or forms of writing themselves, as uncial, scriptio continua, or methods of using papyrus scrolls.
